subject: Re: No detailed test result info -- why?
msgSnippet: ... makes ... Actually, I was already doing that, but d oh!  I found that the output was going into a file named TEST-[classname].txt, and I had expected it to
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, lists.yahoogroups.com@l... wrote:
> > How can I specify, either in the test itself or in my Ant
> > build.xml file, that I want it to tell me which test is
> > being run, where it failed, etc?
>
> Ant does this by default. I think it's pretty silly but I guess it
makes
> sense from Ant's perspective.
>
> You'll need to add an outputter to your junit task with:

Actually, I was already doing that, but d'oh! I found that
the output was going into a file named TEST-[classname].txt,
and I had expected it to go to stdout... just goes to show,
"ls" is your friend. :-)

Thanks for your help!

- Tim
